item.title: South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates: All except 2 presumed dead, say authorities after plane veers off runway at South Korea airport - The Indian Express
item.description:
South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates

Date: Early Sunday
Source: Reuters

Authorities report that all except two crew members are feared dead after a plane carrying 175 passengers crashed and erupted into flames while landing.

  • The accident happened around 9 am local time at Muan International Airport, South Jeolla Province.
  • The flight was a Jeju Air Boeing 737-800, operating from Bangkok to South Korea.
  • 120 bodies have been recovered so far, and the incident is noted as the worst air accident involving a South Korean airline in nearly three decades.
  • The aircraft failed to land correctly and crashed into a wall, leading to an explosion.
  • Recovery efforts are underway, as the acting President ordered all-out rescue operations.
“It is the worst air accident involving a South Korean airline in nearly three decades and it is on track to become the country’s deadliest ever.”

As recovery efforts continue, the focus remains on identifying the casualties and understanding the cause of this tragic incident.

item.title: South Korea plane crash live: 167 of 181 pax confirmed dead, toll likely to rise with only 2 survivors - Hindustan Times
item.description:
South Korea Plane Crash: 167 Confirmed Dead, 2 Survivors

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The tragic incident involves a Jeju Air flight that crashed while landing at Muan International Airport, resulting in confirmed deaths of 167 out of 181 people onboard, with only two survivors.

  • The Jeju Air flight 7C2216 was returning from Bangkok with 175 passengers and 6 crew members.
  • The aircraft veered off the runway and collided with a fence, leading to a fire.
  • Local authorities have confirmed that 167 individuals have died, while others are still missing.
“No words of consolation would suffice for the bereaved families who have suffered this tragedy,” said South Korea's acting president Choi Sang-mok.

This event marks one of the worst air disasters in South Korean aviation history.

item.title: Elon Musk vows to ‘go to war’ to defend H-1B visa programme; Trump sides with him - The Hindu
item.description:
Elon Musk Vows to ‘Go to War’ to Defend H-1B Visa Programme; Trump Sides with Him

Date: December 29, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Elon Musk has received support from President-elect Donald Trump on his stance on H-1B visas, a day after the tech billionaire vowed to defend the program used to bring skilled foreign workers to the U.S.

  • Musk argues that skilled foreign workers are essential for companies like SpaceX and Tesla.
  • Trump expressed his support for the H-1B program, stating he has always favored it.
  • The H-1B visa allows U.S. companies to employ foreign workers in specialty occupations.
  • Musk's comments include criticism of those who oppose immigration in favor of personal gain.
  • The tech industry argues for an increase in H-1B visas to attract talent.
“The reason I’m in America along with so many critical people who built SpaceX, Tesla and hundreds of other companies that made America strong is because of H1B.” - Elon Musk

The ongoing debate around the H-1B visa program continues among Trump’s supporters and immigration critics.

item.title: South Korea plane crash live: Jeju Air CEO apologises; 179 passengers and crew feared killed - Hindustan Times
item.description:
South Korea Plane Crash: Jeju Air CEO Apologises; 179 Passengers and Crew Feared Killed

Date: Dec 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic plane crash involving a Jeju Air flight has left 179 passengers and crew feared dead, with only two survivors confirmed so far. The accident occurred during landing at Muan International Airport.

  • The Jeju Air flight from Bangkok had a total of 181 people onboard.
  • Initial reports suggest a bird strike combined with adverse weather likely caused the crash.
  • Authorities have already recovered 120 bodies and continue searching for more victims.
  • The crash is being called one of the deadliest in South Korean aviation history.
  • Condolences have poured in from international leaders, expressing sorrow for the victims.
“I feel profound responsibility for this incident.” - Kim E-bae, CEO of Jeju Air.

This devastating incident has shocked the nation, prompting immediate emergency response and investigations into the causes of the crash.

item.title: Air Canada plane catches fire on landing hours after South Korea crash; airport shut - The Times of India
item.description:
Air Canada Plane Catches Fire on Landing After South Korea Crash; Airport Shut

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

An Air Canada flight reportedly caught fire while landing, just hours after a separate crash in South Korea raised alarms about flight safety. The incident led to the temporary shutdown of the airport, leading to concerns over air travel security.

  • The Air Canada flight experienced a fire upon landing.
  • This incident comes closely after a plane crash in South Korea.
  • The airport where the incident occurred was shut down for safety inspections.
“Safety is our top priority as we investigate the situation.” - Airport Authority

This incident has raised questions regarding safety measures in aviation following recent events.

item.title: Donald Trump accuses Dems of paying millions to Beyoncé, Oprah and others to endorse Kamala, ‘Totally against the law’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Donald Trump accuses Dems of paying millions to Beyoncé, Oprah and others to endorse Kamala, ‘Totally against the law’

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Donald Trump has accused Democrats of paying millions to celebrities, including Beyoncé and Oprah Winfrey, to endorse Kamala Harris in an attempt to sway public opinion.

  • Trump claimed that such payments, reportedly totaling $11 million, $2 million, and $500,000, are illegal.
  • He labeled Al Sharpton a “con artist” and questioned the legitimacy of the endorsements.
  • It remains uncertain where Trump sourced his financial figures.
  • Beyoncé and Oprah have participated in Harris' campaign activities but deny receiving compensation for their endorsements.
  • Controversy surrounds whether Opra's production company received approximately $2.5 million for production services, contradicting earlier reports.
“Are the Democrats allowed to pay $11,000,000, $2,000,000, and $500,000 to get the ENDORSEMENT of Beyoncé, Oprah, and Reverend Al? I don’t think so!” – Donald Trump

This controversy emphasizes the ongoing tensions in political endorsements and the scrutiny of campaign finances.

item.title: Why did Russia President Putin apologise without taking blame for Azerbaijan Airline crash? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Putin Apologizes for Azerbaijan Airlines Crash Without Taking Blame

Publication Date: [Insert Date]

Source: Hindustan Times

Russian President Vladimir Putin extended a rare public apology following the tragic crash of an Azerbaijan Airlines plane, yet did not acknowledge direct responsibility regarding the incident involving Russia's air defenses.

  • The Azerbaijan Airlines flight J2-8243 crashed during a route from Baku to Grozny, necessitating an emergency landing in Kazakhstan.
  • Initial reports attributed the mishap to fog, but investigations suggest Russian air defense mistakenly targeted the plane.
  • Putin framed his apology within a context of heightened tensions due to ongoing Ukrainian drone assaults.
  • The Kremlin has not accepted blame, citing ongoing investigations and the geopolitical implications of the incident.
  • 29 survivors were reported from the crash, which had distressing visuals of passengers and injuries caused by external interference.
President Ilham Aliyev noted that the plane had been subjected to external interference in Russian airspace.

Putin's non-acknowledgment of fault highlights the geopolitical sensitivity surrounding the incident, reflecting Moscow's strategy in maintaining international perceptions while navigating complex international relations.

item.title: Amsterdam-bound passenger jet skids off runway after emergency landing in Norway - India Today
item.description:
Amsterdam-bound passenger jet skids off runway after emergency landing in Norway

Published on: Dec 29, 2024 By: Devika Bhattacharya

A KLM Royal Dutch Airlines flight heading to Amsterdam from Oslo encountered a hydraulic failure shortly after takeoff, necessitating an emergency landing at Sandefjord Airport.

  • The Boeing 737-800 was carrying 182 people, all of whom were unharmed.
  • The crew diverted to Sandefjord Airport, located approximately 110 kilometers south of Oslo.
  • The aircraft touched down safely but lost control after landing, skidding off runway 18.
  • Authorities have commenced an investigation into the incident, and recovery efforts temporarily disrupted airport operations.

KLM flight #KL1204, a Boeing 737-800, veered off the right side of runway 18 after landing at Oslo Torp Sandefjord Airport.

The incident did not result in any injuries, and passengers were evacuated safely as emergency crews arrived.

item.title: South Korea news LIVE: Plane crash at Muan Airport kills 85, flights cancelled – know latest updates here | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Death Toll in Plane Crash at Muan Airport Rises to 120

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

A tragic plane crash involving Jeju Air flight 7C2216 at Muan International Airport has resulted in a rising death toll, with reports confirming at least 120 fatalities.

  • A Jeju Air flight returning from Thailand crashed after veering off the runway.
  • As of 11:30 am, the death toll reached 120, according to fire officials.
  • Two flight attendants have been rescued; most of the 181 people aboard are presumed dead.
  • The CEO of Jeju Air stated that the cause of the crash remains unclear.
  • Condolences have been expressed by Thailand's Prime Minister.
  • All flights at Muan Airport have been cancelled as emergency crews respond.
“I would like to express my condolences to the families of the deceased and injured.” - Thailand's Prime Minister

This incident marks one of the deadliest aviation disasters in South Korean history, reviving memories of previous tragedies. The authorities are currently investigating the circumstances of the crash.

item.title: Air Canada aircraft catches fire after scary landing hours after fatal South Korea plane tragedy - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Air Canada Aircraft Catches Fire After Scary Landing

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: HT News Desk

An Air Canada flight experienced a harrowing incident at Halifax airport, skidding down the runway and catching fire due to a broken landing gear. This event occurred just hours after a deadly crash in South Korea.

  • An Air Canada flight made an emergency landing at Halifax airport.
  • The aircraft skidded and caught fire after suffering landing gear failure.
  • No casualties were reported in the Halifax incident.
  • The incident followed a tragic plane crash in South Korea, where a Jeju Air Boeing 737 exploded on landing, resulting in 179 presumed deaths.
  • Footage purportedly showed the aircraft's wings scraping the runway, leading to the fiery mishap.
“The Jeju Air plane was carrying 181 passengers; only two are confirmed survivors.”

This accident raises serious concerns about air safety, especially coming on the heels of another devastating plane mishap.

item.title: Who is Scott Biski? NYC teacher accused of creating school ‘escape room’ where he sexually abused female student - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who is Scott Biski? NYC Teacher Accused of Sexual Abuse in School Escape Room

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Scott Biski, a 50-year-old music teacher from Queens, is accused of creating a disturbing "escape room" where he sexually abused a female student. Allegations state he groomed the student since she was 14 and manipulated her into a sexual relationship.

  • Biski referred to his home as the "bat cave" and invited the student there for sexual encounters.
  • He allegedly arranged makeshift spaces in his classroom for inappropriate interactions.
  • Biski gave the girl gifts and frequently messaged her, grooming her over time.
  • The teacher used a fake name to conceal his identity when contacting the victim.
  • A criminal investigation was closed citing consent, but the Special Commissioner of Investigation deemed his actions predatory.
  • Following the allegations, Biski was removed from the school but continued receiving salary until recently.
  • The student filed a lawsuit against him for harassment and assault.
“I have risked everything for you. My job. My home. My kids. Everything.” – Scott Biski

The case has raised concerns about teacher-student boundaries, leading to calls for stricter regulations from the Department of Education.

item.title: Tornadoes touch down in Texas and Mississippi, killing two and injuring six others - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Tornadoes touch down in Texas and Mississippi, killing two and injuring six others

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

At least two people were killed and six more injured as several tornadoes touched down in Texas and Mississippi on Saturday, damaging homes and flipping vehicles.

  • One fatality occurred in the Liverpool area, south of Houston.
  • Four individuals suffered non-critical injuries in Texas.
  • In Mississippi, one death was reported in Adams County, and two injuries in Franklin County.
  • Multiple touchdown points were identified in Brazoria County, with around 10 homes damaged.
  • Utility outages affected about 71,000 customers in Mississippi.
  • Houston airports experienced departure delays exceeding an hour due to severe weather.
“These storms are probably going to get a lot worse this evening and overnight the further east you go,” said meteorologist Josh Lichter.

As of now, first responders are focused on safety and accountability, with more damage assessments planned for the following morning.

item.title: Trump backs H-1B visa programme as Musk vows to go to ‘war’ defending it - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Trump Supports H-1B Visa Program Amid Dispute with Musk

Publication Date: 2024-12-29 Source: Hindustan Times

President-elect Donald Trump has expressed his support for the H-1B visa program amidst a public dispute initiated by Elon Musk, who defended the program against criticism from some of Trump's supporters.

  • Trump stated he has always endorsed the H-1B visa program and utilized it for his businesses.
  • Elon Musk vowed to go to “war” to protect the program, emphasizing its importance for the tech industry.
  • The H-1B visa allows foreign tech workers to temporarily work in the US, with recent applications processed amid political contention.
  • Trump's past criticisms of the program contrast with his current stance, which supports attracting international talent.
  • Far-right activists have challenged Trump over immigration policy, highlighting conflict within the Republican party.
  • The debate is heightened by ongoing discussions about the labor market and the role of immigrant workers in the economy.
“I have many H-1B visas on my properties. I’ve been a believer in H-1B. It’s a great programme.” - Donald Trump

This issue illustrates the complexities surrounding immigration policy, especially as it relates to the tech sector and the opinions of influential figures like Musk.

item.title: It’s a great program: Trump appears to side with Musk in H-1B visa row - The Hindu
item.description:
Trump Supports H-1B Visas Amid Controversy with Musk and Tech Industry

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: New York Post

In a recent interview, President-elect Donald Trump expressed support for H-1B visas, siding with Elon Musk and tech enthusiasts, amidst ongoing disputes about their impact on American jobs.

  • Trump praised H-1B visas as essential for attracting skilled foreign workers.
  • He acknowledged a past of criticizing the program, citing it as 'very bad' for U.S. workers.
  • His previous administration focused on limiting visa usage to prioritize high-skilled applicants.
  • Despite criticisms, Trump indicated his businesses have utilized H-1B visas.
  • The debate over H-1B visas has caused a rift among his conservative base, particularly online.
“I have always liked the visas, I have always been in favor of the visas. That’s why we have them.” – Donald Trump

In conclusion, Trump's recent statements signal a shift in his stance towards H-1B visas, conflicting with the hardline immigration policies that formed a key part of his campaign.

item.title: Biden reportedly regrets dropping out of US presidential race. Could he have beaten Trump? - The Times of India
item.description:
Biden Reportedly Regrets Dropping Out of US Presidential Race: Could He Have Beaten Trump?

Date: October 2023
Source: Unknown

In a reflective turn, President Biden is reportedly regretting his decision to withdraw from the 2024 presidential race, contemplating whether he could have won against Donald Trump.

  • Biden's withdrawal from the race may have been premature.
  • Speculations arise around his chances against Trump.
  • This sentiment reflects the political landscape and potential voter dynamics.
“It's a tough call whether I could have won.”

The sentiments from Biden highlight the complexities of electoral decisions and their long-term impacts on political career trajectories.

item.title: South Korea news LIVE: Plane crash at Muan Airport kills 62, flights cancelled – know latest updates here | Today News - Mint
item.description:
South Korea Plane Crash at Muan Airport Leaves 85 Dead

Published on: [Date Not Provided] Source: Live Mint

A Jeju Air flight with 175 passengers crashed at Muan International Airport while returning from Thailand, leading to a tragic death toll of at least 85. All flights have been canceled in the wake of the incident.

  • Flight 7C2216 crashed into a wall after driving off the runway.
  • Initial reports confirmed 62 deaths, which later rose to 85.
  • All domestic and international flights from South Korea have been canceled.
  • Two Thai nationals were reported to be aboard the flight.
  • Eyewitnesses shared videos of the crash, showing the aircraft without visible landing gear before impact.
“I would like to express my condolences to the families of the deceased and injured.” - Thailand's Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra

This incident marks a significant air disaster in South Korea's recent history, prompting immediate investigations and responses from both South Korean and foreign officials.

item.title: Israel finds massive Hezbollah weapon cache at ‘military base disguised as village’ in Lebanon - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Israel Discovers Large Hezbollah Weapons Cache Disguised as Civilian Infrastructure

Date: Dec 29, 2024 Source: HT News

The Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) have uncovered a significant cache of weapons hidden within civilian infrastructure in southern Lebanon, highlighting concerns about Hezbollah's military operations within civilian areas.

  • Findings included a truck mounted with 40 rocket launcher barrels near Naqoura.
  • Additional weapons were discovered inside a pharmacy, including explosives and RPG missiles.
  • Hezbollah is reportedly preparing for further conflict and has resumed reconstruction efforts.
  • The IDF conducted an airstrike targeting Hezbollah's weapons smuggling unit.
  • Growing tensions between the IDF and UNIFIL regarding ceasefire agreements.
“Those aren't villages with some military infrastructure, this is a military base disguised as a civilian area.” - Sarit Zahavi, president of the Alma Research Center

The IDF's discovery underscores ongoing instability in the region, with potential long-term implications for both Israel and Lebanon.

item.title: NYC teacher 'Arthur Dent' sexually abused student in ‘escape room’ and home ‘bat cave’ - The Times of India
item.description:
NYC teacher 'Arthur Dent' sexually abused student in ‘escape room’ and home ‘bat cave’

Publication Date: Not specifiedSource: Not specified

An NYC teacher, known as Arthur Dent, is facing serious allegations of sexually abusing a student both in an escape room and at his residence, which he referred to as a 'bat cave'.

  • Allegations involve multiple incidents of sexual abuse.
  • Events took place in unconventional settings, raising concerns about safety and trust in educational environments.
  • The case is currently under investigation.
"These allegations are deeply troubling and must be taken seriously to protect students."

The ongoing investigation highlights the need for strict safeguarding measures in schools to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future.

item.title: Trump sides with Elon Musk in H-1B visa debate, says he's always been in favor of the program - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Trump Supports H-1B Visa Program Amid Debate with Elon Musk

Published on 28 December 2024, IST by a reputable news source.

President-elect Donald Trump openly sided with Elon Musk in a debate over the H-1B visa program, indicating his support for the program in the face of opposition from some of his supporters.

  • Trump expressed his longstanding support for the H-1B visa program, which allows foreign tech workers to work in the U.S.
  • This stance comes after Musk vowed to defend the program amid criticism from far-right activists.
  • Trump previously moved to restrict H-1B visas during his first presidency.
  • The controversy arose following Trump's choice of an Indian American adviser on AI, prompting backlash from some of his supporters.
  • Musk highlighted the need for skilled foreign workers, mentioning Tesla's use of 724 H-1B visas this year.
"I have many H-1B visas on my properties. I've been a believer in H-1B. I have used it many times. It's a great program." - Donald Trump

The ongoing debate emphasizes the dichotomy within Trump's supporters regarding immigration policies, especially in the tech sector, which relies heavily on H-1B visas.

item.title: AT&T Says Its Network Is Now Clear After Salt Typhoon Hack | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
AT&T Says Its Network Is Now Clear After Salt Typhoon Hack

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Bloomberg

AT&T Inc. reported that it was targeted in the Salt Typhoon hacking operation linked to China, but asserts that its network is now secure. The telecom giant is collaborating with authorities and notifying individuals whose information may have been compromised.

  • The hackers aimed to gather information on foreign intelligence.
  • AT&T has reported no current activity by nation-state actors in its networks.
  • The company has complied with notification obligations in cooperation with law enforcement.
  • AT&T and Verizon were among the telecom carriers affected by the Salt Typhoon intrusion.
  • The White House confirmed that nine telecom companies were breached.
  • US officials are still assessing the extent of the targeted individuals.
  • The Biden administration held a closed-door session with telecom industry leaders to discuss vulnerabilities.
“We detect no activity by nation-state actors in our networks at this time.” - AT&T

In conclusion, AT&T is taking measures to secure its network and enhance customer data protection following the breach, while the investigation continues into the Salt Typhoon incident.

item.title: Why will India’s foreign policy be a tightrope walk?: Explained - The Hindu
item.description:
Why will India’s foreign policy be a tightrope walk?: Explained

Published Date: December 29, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The article discusses the complexities and challenges facing India's foreign policy as it navigates through a tumultuous global landscape with significant geopolitical shifts.

  • 2024 saw numerous diplomatic visits and notable events impacting India's external relations.
  • Key negotiations for disengagement with China were significant milestones.
  • India's relationships with neighboring countries remain crucial, with mixed outcomes this year.
  • Bilateral ties with Canada deteriorated due to serious allegations.
  • India has maintained a neutral stance amidst global conflicts, positioning itself as a mediator.
  • Looking ahead, 2025 promises high-profile diplomatic engagements, including visits from major world leaders.
“With both the Russia-Ukraine conflict and Israel’s war in Gaza, India consistently put itself on the 'side of peace'.”

In conclusion, India's foreign policy in the near future will require a delicate balance as it addresses emerging global tensions while trying to maintain stability in its relationships.

item.title: Bangladesh journalists 'sacked on students' demand', media associations in India flag 'mob threat' - ThePrint
item.description:
Bangladesh journalists 'sacked on students' demand', media associations in India flag 'mob threat'

Publication Date: New Delhi, Date Unknown | Source: ThePrint

The Foreign Correspondents’ Club of South Asia, Press Club of India, and the Indian Association of Foreign Affairs Correspondents have expressed concern over the sacking of five journalists from Somoy TV in Bangladesh, following protests led by student leaders.

  • Five veteran journalists were dismissed after Hasnat Abdullah, a student leader, protested their presence on social media.
  • These dismissals have raised alarms about press freedom in Bangladesh.
  • The journalists claimed they were asked to resign for the 'greater good' of the channel.
  • The situation reflects increasing pressure on media outlets amid rising student-led protests.
“Hasnat Abdullah’s visit to a TV channel’s newsroom demanding favourable coverage is nothing but news censorship and policing of information through the threat of mob action.”

Concerns about media repression have escalated, with calls for the journalists' reinstatement and for the government to uphold press freedoms.

item.title: Donald Trump breaks silence on H-1B row, supports Elon-Vivek: 'It's a great program' - The Times of India
item.description:
Donald Trump breaks silence on H-1B row, supports Elon-Vivek: 'It's a great program'

Publication Date: Date not specified
Source: Times of India

In a recent statement, Donald Trump expressed his support for the H-1B visa program, siding with tech leaders Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy amidst a controversy about immigration and job competition.

  • Trump affirmed the value of the H-1B program as a vital resource for the US economy.
  • His comments come in the context of public backlash regarding the current immigration policies.
  • Musk and Ramaswamy have been vocal proponents of the program, emphasizing its importance in the tech industry.
“It's a great program,” Trump stated, highlighting its positive impact on America’s workforce.

Trump's remarks reflect ongoing debates about the future of immigration in the US, particularly concerning skilled labor from abroad.
